title: Extreme Sports Medicine Education: Strengthening Practical Skills Based on Collaborative Autoethnography

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Course for corporate health managers or team leaders to strengthen injury prevention and response capabilities related to extreme sports. Operated in a blended format combining face-to-face workshops and a mobile learning platform. Most learners are in PC-free environments

learning_goals: Learners can identify five or more major types of injuries that may occur in extreme sports environments and explain prevention strategies.
Learners can conduct case analyses with peer learners using collaborative autoethnography techniques and evaluate the impact of individual cultural biases on medical judgments.
Learners can develop personalized emergency response plans considering three core elements: individual (physical conditions), task (sports skills), and environment (equipment/location).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
